alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Lackawanna; Northern Wayne; Pike; Southern Wayne; Susquehanna (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 17 at 4:53AM EST until January 17 at 5:00PM EST by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected, with spotty freezing rain possible. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. Ice accumulations of a light glaze, mainly in the Poconos and Catskills. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph, strongest in mountainous terrain. * WHERE...In Pennsylvania, Bradford, Susquehanna, Wayne, Lackawanna, and Pike counties. In New York, Chenango, Otsego, Broome and Delaware counties. * WHEN...Until 5 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Drier air aloft will cause snow to become intermittent this morning, with some increase in coverage later today. While the bulk of the snow has already fallen, strong winds will cause very low visibility and drifting in places through the day. Spotty freezing rain is possible in parts of the Catskills and Poconos. Some valley locations, particularly in NE Pennsylvania will mostly see rain for much of the early morning. Warnings may be dropped early in some areas later this morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions for New York can be found at 511ny.org, or by dialing 5 1 1 from within the state. The latest road conditions for Pennsylvania can be found at 511pa.com, or by dialing 5 1 1 from within the state.

area.areaDesc: Bradford; Lackawanna; Northern Wayne; Pike; Southern Wayne; Susquehanna
